segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing onto the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she just keeps drying that plate like nothing is happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children behind her, one climbing a wobbly stool to reach the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for a cookie, not even noticing the danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman should turn around and see what’s happening before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe no one is reacting to the water or the stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall, and the water is going to make everything slippery.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will notice before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is a disaster waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
